intro: Panicum hydaspicum, commonly known as the Himalayan panicgrass, is a perennial grass species native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets, typical of the Poaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Panicum hydaspicum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its resilience and ability to stabilize soil in arid and semi-arid regions.
